description: Redevelopment of site by erection of 5 storey building comprising 1402 m2 of A1 gross floorspace (Lidl supermarket) and 76 residential flats (6012m2 gross floorspace), of which 24 will be for affordable housing (32%), together with associated car parking (98 retail and 66 residential), servicing, landscaping and a new vehicle access from Ruislip Road East
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings, details of vehicular access, including off-site works, new vehicular and pedestrian accesses, traffic control/management system, and programme for implementation shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works.  Such details as approved shall be implemented in accordance with the approved programme and thereafter permanently retained.    REASON: In the interests of highway safety, and to protect living conditions of occupiers in the surrounding area and the character and appearance of the surrounding area, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.5 of the adopted Ealing unitary development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Development shall not begin until details of drainage works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority; the scheme as approved shall be carried out before any part of the development permitted is occupied.  REASON: To ensure that adequate drainage of the site is carried out as approved, in accordance with policy 2.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A detailed tree survey and method statement for measures to ensure full tree protection to BS 5837 shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of works on site.   The Details to be submitted shall include the following:   i. Tree survey and measures shall be marked on a site plan  ii. A full site survey indicating all existing features as well as existing and proposed final levels and full tree survey shall be provided to BS 5837: 1991 'Trees in Relation to Construction'.  Species, Age, Height, Measured Canopy-spread and Diameter at Breast Height along with individual tree category in relation to the site including the protective fence type and distances are required.  All relevant trees off site shall be included.    iii. All protective measures to comply with BS 5837 protection zones shall be in place before any site changes are made.    iv. Tree survey and details of method statement for replacement of hard standing areas or any surface level changes surrounding the base of any trees either on site or those off site and with reference to demolition and construction of the development,   v. Details of any proposed underground or over ground services and method statement to avoid damage to fragile root systems below the surface, to include hand excavation within the protection zones (refer to NJUG10)  vi. Details of construction of buildings and chemical materials storage and temporary construction buildings, details of machinery required on site for demolition, delivery and construction, including details of access routes in and out of the site. The approved method statement shall be implemented prior to commencement of works, and applied until the end of the construction period.  REASON:  To prevent damage to the trees and in the interest of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policy 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The existing trees on the site shall not be lopped, felled or otherwise affected in any way (including raising or lowering soil levels under the crown spread of the trees) and no excavation shall be cut under the crown spread of the trees without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees to be lopped or felled shall be replaced to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To safeguard the trees in the interest of visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policy 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants, which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme, shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policy 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment shall be completed before the buildings are used.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter permanently retained.   REASON: To protect the amenity of the area, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until a schedule of landscape maintenance for a minimum period of 5 years has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Landscape maintenance shall be carried out in accordance with the approved schedule.  REASON:  To protect the landscaping in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policy 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers and Guidance Notes For The Reduction Of Light Pollution will be met particularly with regard to the following:  (I) reducing glare by correctly aiming the luminaires using luminaires with double asymmetric beams designed so that the front glazing is kept at or near parallel to the surface being lit ensuring that the main beam angle of all lights, directed towards a potential observer is kept below 70 degrees;  (ii)  controlling vertical illuminance with the lights operating to a maximum of 10 lux at ground level and 5 lux at first floor level at any affected facade; and  (iii) demonstrating that the period of operation of the floodlights will be prohibited during the period 2200 to dawn, preferably by installation of an automatic time control switch.  The details shall be implemented as approved at time of first installation and thereafter be retained.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers in surrounding area in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of all external lighting to be erected, demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers 'Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution' and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9, must be submitted in writing to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing.  The lighting as approved must be installed prior to the first occupation of any part  of the development and maintained in accordance with these standards thereafter.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the properties surrounding the site in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The retail element of the development hereby approved shall operate only between the hours of 8.00am - 21.00pm Monday to Saturday, and 10.00am - 5.00pm Sundays and Public Holidays.  REASON: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of time and frequency of retail deliveries shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first occupation of the retail unit. Such times as are approved by the Local Planing Authority shall be complied with thereafter from the date of first opening of the retail unit for trading purposes.  REASON: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Any machinery or equipment that is fixed to the building structure should be fixed with suitable anti-vibration isolators and satisfy an acoustic standard of not exceeding NR25 (Leq 5mins) inside a habitable room - details to be approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development and such details as are approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and retained permanently thereafter.  REASON: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | 10% of the scheme's residential units shall comply with the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance with regard to wheelchair manoeuvering, door openings, kitchen space and access to communal terrace. Details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of development and such details as are approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the residential part of the site and retained permanently thereafter.  REASON: To provide for a reasonable level of disabled access, in accordance with policy 4.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the information shown on the submitted drawings, details of a refuse storage and waste management programme, including specification and location of the proposed waste compactor, for the development hereby permitted, in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision as approved shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of each phase of the development permitted and be retained permanently.  REASON:  To ensure adequate refuse storage and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the design of the building and car/cycle and parking area, hard and soft landscaping and bin storage areas to comply with the aims and objectives of Secured By Design and Secured Car Parks award shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of development. The approved details shall be implemented before the first occupation of the development, and shall be permanently retained.  REASON: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with policies 4.3 and 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note 7: 'Safer Ealing'.
